ratings.comment: He is one of the best instructor
Professor Klein is probably the best professor I've had at UW. Knows the material  better than anyone and makes the class the perfect difficulty for a tech elective

It seems like he really knows his stuff, but he put WAY more of an emphasis on using EES than the actual content. If you want to do well on the homework which is 45 of the grade then spend 98 of your time learning EES and the other 2 learning the content for the class. A good professor overall but he should be teaching Computer Science, not ME

Klein is by far the best professor I have come across. He dedicates himself to teaching the skills you need to be a knowledgable practicing engineer. This class challenged me like no other has, and forced me to dig deep to learn the material, not just pass another stepping stone on the way to graduation. Take him if you can!

Klein is the boss. Super-knowledgeable and experienced about what he teaches. EES (which he made for the most part) is a life-saver and super-useful. He might come off as intimidating in class but if you go to his office hours he is kind and super helpful.
Best professor! he cares a great deal for his students, he is very flexible and willing to change and accomodate, EES had no issues , crystal clear and no issues!!!

Hes a mixed bag. PROS: Knows his stuff REALLY well. Real world applications. CONS: He is unwilling to change anything. Approachable, but not helpful. Has "Find it yourself" mentality. Not enough time given for exams. Too much time spent on HW & debugging EES. EES extremely unreliable. Doesn't do examples. Doesn't care about student effort level.

Definitely the most informative class I've had so far. All the material is directly applicable to real world examples, and he emphasizes this importance. He can be a bit of a smart-ass, but in his office he's very helpful, and approachable. The homeworks could be a real pain,but their helpfulness in the real world was unquestionable.

Very experienced and knowledgeable, the book (which he wrote) is an invaluable resource. Learn to enjoy EES and his homework will not be tedious, although some problems are very challenging. He will notice if you sleep through his class.

Excellent.  He engages the class and provides relevant problem examples, and he's funny.  He follows the book (which he co-wrote) almost exactly.  His tests are tricky, but fair - nothing you haven't seen before if you've been to class.  Highly recommended.
Great professor. If you want to learn how to think like a real engineer, Klein is the man. The homeworks are not tedious, they just require hard thinking.

Ole Sanford is a pretty bad Professor. He over uses a powerpoint in lecture (to the point of boredom), and his tests are fast pace. The homeworks are not conceptually hard, but they are extremely long and tedious. Learn to enjoy EES if you dare adventure into the world of Klein!

Not a great teacher but very knowledgable, gives general outline of whats important but you'll need to look in textbook for extras. Pretty intense, no BS guy...not patient. Will make you feel like an idiot if you ask a dumb question. Decent prof as long as you put in the work to learn yourself.
